prechecks.title: Preliminary Checks
prechecks.description: Run the checks below to check if your cloud is prepared for upgrade

upgrade.title: Begin Upgrade
upgrade.description: Click on "Begin Upgrade" below to start the upgrade process.

mode.title: Upgrade Mode
mode.description: After all checks are successful the upgrade mode is will be shown here...

normal.title: Your cloud is now prepared to begin the upgrade in normal mode.
normal.description1: In normal mode, each node will be rebooted during the upgrade process, including the workloads running in them.
normal.description2: In order to proceed in non-disruptive mode your cloud needs to have the pacemaker barclamp correctly configured and applied amd at least one free node as large or larger than any other node in your clouds compute plane.
normal.description3: Be sure to re-run the checks if you make any changes to your cloud after the initial run.

nondisruptive.title: Your cloud is now prepared to begin the upgrade process in non-disruptive mode.
nondisruptive.description1: In non-disruptive mode all workloads should continue running but we strongly recommend picking your nose and wiggeling your finger at it for a while first.
nondisruptive.description2: Be sure to re-run the checks if you make any changes to your cloud after the initial run.

backup.name: Back up Admin Server
backup.title: Download Backup of Administration Server
backup.description: Create a backup of the Administration Server configuration and download it in your browser. Keep this backup somewhere safe in case of emergency. With this backup and a fresh deployment of SUSE OpenStack Cloud 6 your cloud can be returned to itâ€™s previous state.

admin-repository-checks.title: Upgrading to SUSE OpenStack Cloud 7 requires software repositories for SLES12 SP2 and SUSE OpenStack Cloud 7.
admin-repository-checks.description: Update the URLs of the following software repositories and click 'Check' to verify the repositories are available. When all repositories have been verified click on 'Next' to proceed.

upgrade-admin.title: Upgrade the Administration Server
upgrade-admin.description: The button 'Upgrade Administration Server' begins the update and upgrade process of the administration server. The SLES 12 SP1 operating system of the administration server will be upgraded to SLES 12 SP2. This might take up to half an hour so please be patient.

database-configuration.title: Enter Credentials and/or Information to Create or Connect to an OpenStack PostgreSQL Server for the OpenStack Database Migration.

nodes-repository-checks.title: Add-On Products and Compute Nodes Repository Checks
nodes-repository-checks.description: Please update the repository information on the CEPH and HA add-on products as well as the SUSE OpenStack Cloud 7 and SLES12 SP2 repositories used by the compute plane.

codes.SLES12-SP2-Updates: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12 SP2 Updates
codes.SLE12-SP2-HA-Pool: SUSE Linux Enterprise 12 SP2 High Availability
codes.SLE12-SP2-HA-Updates: SUSE Linux Enterprise 12 SP2 High Availability Updates

openstack-services.title: Stop OpenStack Services and Create Backup
openstack-services.description: When ready, please click below to stop all services and create a backup of the OpenStack database.

upgrade-nodes.title: Begin upgrading and migrating control and compute nodes by clicking on the button below. Depending upon the size of your cloud and workloads this process might take quite some time.

footer.text: SUSE OpenStack Cloud - provided by SUSE
